content:
I'm interested in thoughts on: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/570
It'd be pretty trivial to add things on the left sidebar that are "messages with attachments" or "messages with links" (there's already working search queries has:attachment and has:link); the question is do we think that'd be an improvement.
I personally never really used those searches before.

For these sort of marginally useful ideas (I could see this idea being really useful in certain office environment and total clutter in other orgs), I want to build up a UI concept where you can do "expert" stuff like peruse recent topics w/fancy sort options or keep track of your uploads or manage your starred messages or go into wiki/blog mode, etc.
I use them basically when I remember someone sent a mockup (or whatever) but it was a few months ago
But I guess I almost always combine them with another operator
So my leaning would be to close the issue and instead focus on making the search functionality more discoverable to help with this
haha, didn't know we supported it. Searching by link/attachment would indeed have been useful for me a couple of times, but agree with just making it more discoverable in search.
Opened https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/3754 for highlighting this in the documentation

Would it be a nice idea to include a "delete all" button for uploaded files? When I tried to clear them now, I had to manually click delete on every one. From my usage, I don't think I'll require a quick access to uploaded files after one time and personally I would benefit from said feature.
What actually happens when we delete a file? I've never actually used this feature. (In particular what happens with the messages where you originally did the uploads?)
The messages still have the uploads.
The only use for this feature from what I've observed is that you can you get a list of al uploads, the messages they were used in and a download option.
All of which are still accessible even if we delete the row.
If you delete the uploads, the links in messages become broken links.

I could still see the image after I deleted the upload yesterday. It did not disappear instantly.
I can't see it now though.
That's most likely browser caching.

Abhishek B Chakravarthi said:

Would it be a nice idea to include a "delete all" button for uploaded files? When I tried to clear them now, I had to manually click delete on every one. From my usage, I don't think I'll require a quick access to uploaded files after one time and personally I would benefit from said feature.

it would also be nice to include the "download all" button, for download all files in the same messagge @Abhishek B Chakravarthi
If you want to have a delete all files for a specific message, where do you propose we have this button?
The "Message actions" menu would be a good place for that.

Cyphase said:

The "Message actions" menu would be a good place for that.

i agree with you

To finalize, what do we need in "message actions" and the settings page?
Download all in message actions and delete all in settings page?
grey-acrylic-lantern-pendant-light-1024x667.jpg
@Mahesh Saraswati Are you testing? Please use #test here if this was a test message.
I don't think I want to add another top-level item in "Message actions" for deleting uploads in a message; that feels very expensive in terms of screen real estate.
What about the setting page delete all? Although I'm reconsidering using that if the attachments are gone.
We could potentially do that. Or offer some UI on the messages for attachments you yourself uploaded for this sort of thing. Though I'm not sure this is an important area to spend design time on.

Cyphase said:

The "Message actions" menu would be a good place for that.

Tim Abbott said:

I don't think I want to add another top-level item in "Message actions" for deleting uploads in a message; that feels very expensive in terms of screen real estate.

Whoops, I misread; I was specifically referring to a "Download All" button being in "Message actions", not a "Delete All" button.
And that only if there are at least either 1 or 2 files attached.
